Oklahoma_City.Heartland Baptist Bible College: Heartland Baptist Bible College is an unaccredited Independent Fundamental Baptist Bible college in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, which offers undergraduate diplomas (the state of Oklahoma does not allow unaccredited institutions to award degrees) in pastoral theology, missions, youth, Christian ministries, music education, Christian education (elementary and secondary) and secretarial science. Sam Davison, president of the institution since 1999, retired as pastor of Southwest Baptist Church, Oklahoma City, in May 2010. Before 1998, the college was located in San Dimas, California, and was known as Pacific Coast Baptist Bible College.
